nodes.text: Team Millennium Holos was a professional swoop racing team that competed on the TransGal circuit. Although it once reigned as the top-ranked team in the galaxy, it had lost that status by 22 BBY. That year, the team competed in a race on the planet of Corulag, and strong performances from its members Ignar Ominaz and Dretti Grond propelled Team Millennium Holos back to the top ranking.

At one point, Team Millennium Holos was the top-ranked professional swoop racing team in the galaxy, competing on the TransGal circuit, but it had fallen from first place by 22 BBY. That year, its members included racers named Ignar Ominaz and Dretti Grond, both of whom competed in a race on the planet of Corulag. Ominaz's win there, along with Grond's fourth place finish, restored Team Millennium Holos' status as the top team. After the race on Corulag, the Holos planned to take part in the next race in the circuit, the Stassia Classic.
Team Millennium Holos consisted of associated swoop pilots, including Ignar Ominaz and Dretti Grond. Its members raced cooperatively on a galactic swoop racing circuit called the TransGal circuit.

Team Millennium Holos was featured in an issue of the HoloNet News feed (2002), Volume 531, Issue 54, which was published in-universe on the second day of the fifth month in 22 BBY. The article that referenced the team, entitled "Ominaz Keeps Top Ranking," was written by Pablo Hidalgo and Paul Ens. Millennium Holos was a holo production company previously established in the Star Wars galaxy with the Han Solo and the Corporate Sector Sourcebook, written in 1993 by Michael Allen Horne, but a definitive connection between that company and the team was not established in HoloNet News.
